data.title: U.S. facts and figures
data.meta_description: Learn about the United States, including American holidays, the American flag, presidents, census data, and the U.S. Constitution.
data.text:
An official website of the United States government

Hereâs how you know

Learn about the duties of president, vice president, and first lady of the United States. Find out how to contact and learn more about current and past leaders.

If a U.S. president cannot carry out the duties of the office, the responsibilities are passed to another government leader in a specific order.

Get the facts about the U.S. flag and when to fly it at half staff. Learn about other national symbols.

The United States recognizes 12 federal holidays. Learn about federal, state, and cultural holidays celebrated in the U.S.Â

Find out if the United States has an official language, and learn about languages spoken in the U.S.

The United States dollar is the official currency of the U.S. and its territories. Learn about the bills and coins that make up U.S. currency.

Learn about the United States' founding documents, known together as the Charters of Freedom.

Learn about the U.S. Census and how the government uses its population data.
